New Records: Nick Castellanos achieved his fourth walk-off hit of the season.
Spencer Schwellenbach extended the Braves franchise record for consecutive starts allowing three runs or fewer to 21 straight.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a game-winning single in the 11th inning.
Carlos Estévez pitched the 10th and 11th innings, retiring all six batters he faced.
Matt Strahm loaded the bases with one out in the ninth inning but managed to get out of the jam.
Michael Harris II hit a home run off Aaron Nola in the third inning.
Whit Merrifield drove in a run by beating out a potential double-play grounder in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos commented on his comfort in high-pressure situations, attributing it to his early field work.
Carlos Estévez expressed excitement about the Philadelphia crowd and the playoff-like atmosphere.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Aaron Nola's performance and command of his pitches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a playoff-like atmosphere with a sellout crowd.
Aaron Nola achieved his 18th quality start of the season, second-most in the majors behind teammate Zack Wheeler.
Others: Phillies 3B Alec Bohm missed a second straight game due to a strained left hand but is expected to play in the upcoming series against Toronto.
The game was held at Citizens Bank Park with an attendance of 43,249 and lasted 3 hours and 14 minutes.
